65155a370c653f5fb9cb70ceff32710c (07:17): james, i worked out how i will install the b42 vermillion copy; live upgrade (and 2 spare BEs) is my friend
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (07:18): 2 spare BEs?
65155a370c653f5fb9cb70ceff32710c (07:18): my notebook has 4 BEs on it (by choice)
65155a370c653f5fb9cb70ceff32710c (07:19): the idea was two for nevada upgrading; one for my open solaris build and one to play with
65155a370c653f5fb9cb70ceff32710c (07:19): or I could live dangerously and grab a nightly of b42 ;)
65155a370c653f5fb9cb70ceff32710c (07:19): i see they have already set the GCN for jurassic to go to 42
631e53f91030c509ce45bb16bd235cdd (07:20): i've gotta learn how to setup them BEs eventually.
65155a370c653f5fb9cb70ceff32710c (07:20): real easy, you create a slice the same size as your root partition
65155a370c653f5fb9cb70ceff32710c (07:20): that's about it
65155a370c653f5fb9cb70ceff32710c (07:20): you then choose it as a target to copy your current root to
cda365fefc1c0c3a4e5c1dd9770f4c09 (07:21): what's a BE?
65155a370c653f5fb9cb70ceff32710c (07:21): a live upgrade boot environment
65155a370c653f5fb9cb70ceff32710c (07:21): soon to be *much* nicer when everything works with bootable zfs
daa08b04a71644cbce3e6e7e5aeeb58e (07:21): finally have dhcp relay on ever subnet
daa08b04a71644cbce3e6e7e5aeeb58e (07:22): can jumpstart from anywhere where on the network now
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (07:22): Tpenta: what's the motivation to get newer vermillion bits?
65155a370c653f5fb9cb70ceff32710c (07:23): and it's not in the b41 bits
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (07:23): Oh, yeah, that's not in what was delivered.
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (07:23): it also complains a whole lot and does nothing, at least on the 41c bits.

cda365fefc1c0c3a4e5c1dd9770f4c09 (07:24): oh yes, live upgrade with zfs would be way cool... I gave up on liveupgrade when I discovered it needed to copy everything to another partition/slice, but with zfs/zpool I wouldn't need to reserve a partition for it right?
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (07:25): In a perfect world it could (will?) operate on clones.
631e53f91030c509ce45bb16bd235cdd (07:25): it's easier to build ON than JDS.
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (07:25): I'm yet to actually build more than half of JDS.
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (07:26): though the SFW build needing the java 1.2 bits is comparibly annoying, I think.
